snippet: The Bureau of Prisons could save taxpayer money and reduce overcrowding if it better managed its “compassionate release” program, according to the Justice Department’s inspector general.
abstract: Justice Department report finds that federal Bureau of Prisons could save taxpayer money and reduce overcrowding if it better managed program for compassionate release of inmates who are dying or facing other extraordinary circumstances.
lead_paragraph: The Bureau of Prisons could save taxpayer money and reduce overcrowding if it better managed its “compassionate release” program, according to the Justice Department’s inspector general.

headline.seo: Report Urges More ‘Compassionate Release’ of Federal Prisoners
headline.main: More Releases of Ailing Prisoners Are Urged
